From: Martin Weinberg •cl 
To: ' , "Martin 
Weinberg" ,  Reid Weingarten 
Subject: Re: US v Epstein - Preservation Requests 
Date: Thu, 01 Aug 2019 21:05:38 +0000 
Attachments: 8.1.19_Supplemental_Discovety_Letter_Epstein_(1).pdf 
M, see attached. If you would like, I can forward to My only time sensitive 
request is whether it is your intention (and if no decision has  reached untilyou return let me 
know and we will wait) whether I will need to ask eg AUSA 
or
 AUSA to preserve 
documents or whether I can expect that this request will be forwarded to appropriate persons by you 
and your team. 
Thanks 
Marty 
Martin G. Weinberg, Esq. 
20 Park Plaza 
Suite 1000 
Boston, MA 02116 
- Office 
- Cell 
 This Electronic Message contains information from the 
Law Office of Martin G. Weinberg, P.C., and may be privileged. The information is intended for the use 
of the addressee only. If you are not the addressee, please note that any disclosure, copying, 
distribution, or use of the contents of this message is prohibited. 
On Thursday, August 1, 2019, 03:35:47 PM EDT, 
Marty, 
I think it would be useful for you to send that follow-up letter today or tomorrow, and we should be able to incorporate it 
into our response. Apologies again for the delay but it is in progress. 
c 
thanks, 
From: Martin Weinberg <=1.IM> 
Sent: Thursday, August 01, 2019 15:31    
To:  
) 
Subject: Re: US v Epstein - Preservation Requests 
; Martin Weinberg
wrote: 
EFTA00020937

Hi M, hopefully your travels are for personal pleasure and not business but I  won't inquire. I have a followup 
letter than 
focuses on AUSAI 
(SD Fla) and whether you would send a request to her to 
preserve 
potentially relevant documents. I  can either email it to you today so you can consider it in concert with the other 
requests or hold it and we can discuss further when you return 
Thanks 
Marty 
Martin G. Weinberg, 
Esq. 
20 Park Plaza 
Suite 1000 
Boston. 
MA 02116 
  - Office 
- Cell

On Thursday, August I, 2019, 02:59:25 PM EDT, 
Marty, 
wrote: 
I'm unfortunately traveling this afternoon and tomorrow through the weekend —  we had hoped to get you a responsive letter 
very shortly but it may be next week instead. Apologies for the delay, but we could speak Monday or Tuesday and in any 
event will get you the full response in the coming days as well. 
thanks, 
From: Martin Weinberg <=1.IM> 
Sent: Thursday, August 01, 2019 14:00   
To: 
Subject: US v Epstein - Preservation Requests 
; Martin Weinberg <=EIM> 
Hi= 
Can we have a short call regarding what I can reasonably expect in the way of my earlier letter seeking your notifying other relevant 
districts, DOJ of my preservation request. 
Thanks 
Marty 
Martin G. Weinberg, Esq. 
20 Park Plaza 
Suite 1000 
Boston, MA 02116
